str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
And, even, also, namely.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Magnificent, superb, transcendent, majestic. From megas and prepo; befitting greatness or magnificence.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From agapao; beloved.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.
